Japanâ€™s extraordinary culture is like no other in the world. The 2,000-year-old civilization grew through periods of seclusion and assimilation to cultivate a society responsible for immeasurable influences on the rest of the world. What makes Japan so distinctive? The answer is more than just spiritual beliefs or culinary tastes. Itâ€™s the ongoing clash between tradition and modernity; a conflict shaped by Japanâ€™s long history of engagement and isolation.
